Techniques like active recall, which encourages retrieving information from memory instead of merely reviewing, have been supported by research to foster deeper understanding and long-term retention of material. Embracing these strategies not only indicates a proactive approach to learning but also reflects a broader desire to engage with the material meaningfully, which will likely lead to a greater passion for your studies and even to lifelong learning outside traditional frameworks.
